title: Characteristics of the graph of the parent function
text: The function $$f(x)=\log_{b}\left(x\right)$$, $$b>0$$ and b not equal to 1, has the following properties: - one-to-one function \\n - vertical asymptote: $$x=0$$ \\n - domain: $$(0,\infty)$$ \\n - range: $$(-\infty,\infty)$$ \\n - x-intercept: (1,0) and key point (b,1) \\n - y-intercept: none \\n - increasing if $$b>1$$ \\n - decreasing if $$0<b<1$$

title: Transformations of log functions
text: To achieve the function above, the parent function is translated left 9 units, horizontally compressed by a factor of $$\frac{1}{3}$$, reflected across the x-axis, and translated down 7 units. How does this affect the vertical asymptote?
